summary: The diff shows backend subscription plan CRUD methods and frontend React Query hooks have been implemented, but there is no evidence of the admin UI component (AdminSubscriptionPlansManagement.tsx) or the PricingSection component integration for public display. The core data layer is present but the user-facing interfaces are missing.

missing_requirements.requirement: Create admin interface for managing subscription plans with ability to add, edit, and delete plans
missing_requirements.reason: No AdminSubscriptionPlansManagement.tsx component found in diff. The BuildRequest explicitly requires using existing AdminSubscriptionPlansManagement.tsx component, but it's not shown as added or modified. Backend methods exist (createSubscriptionPlan, updateSubscriptionPlan, deleteSubscriptionPlan) and hooks are in useQueries.ts, but the actual admin UI component is missing.

missing_requirements.requirement: Display all active subscription plans publicly on the landing page in the existing PricingSection component location
missing_requirements.reason: No PricingSection.tsx component found in diff. The BuildRequest explicitly requires using existing PricingSection.tsx component, but it's not shown as modified. The useGetAllSubscriptionPlans hook exists in useQueries.ts, but there's no evidence of PricingSection component fetching or displaying the plans.

hallucinated_features.description: Video submission admin interface with status management, live URLs, download, edit, and delete functionality
hallucinated_features.reason: AdminVideoSubmissions.tsx contains extensive video submission management features (status changes, live URL input, download, edit, delete dialogs) that were not requested in BuildRequest. This appears to be from previous work unrelated to subscription plans feature.

hallucinated_features.description: Video submission query hooks and mutations
hallucinated_features.reason: useQueries.ts includes video submission hooks (useSubmitVideo, useGetAllVideoSubmissions, useUpdateVideoStatus, useDeleteVideoSubmission, useDownloadVideoFile) that were not part of the subscription plans BuildRequest.
